thread.title: Former Patriots offensive lineman Adams, 67, dies in Houston
thread.title_full: Former Patriots offensive lineman Adams, 67, dies in Houston

title: Former Patriots offensive lineman Adams, 67, dies in Houston
text:
Former Patriots offensive lineman Adams, 67, dies in Houston 
HOUSTON (AP) - Former New England offensive lineman Sam Adams has died in Houston. 
Rodney Coleman, with Coleman's Mortuary in Jasper, says Adams became ill at his Houston home last Saturday and died at a hospital. Adams was 67. 
No cause of death was immediately released Wednesday. 
The funeral is at 2:30 p.m. Saturday at Church of Jesus Christ House of Prayer in Jasper, 120 miles northeast of Houston. 
Adams, who was a Jasper native, played for Prairie View A&M before joining the Patriots in 1972. He spent most of his NFL career with New England, finishing with New Orleans in 1981. 
His son, also named Sam Adams, played for Texas A&M before joining the Seahawks in 1994, in an NFL career through 2007 with stops in Baltimore, Oakland, Buffalo, Cincinnati and Denver.
